Description: This corpus contains texts from the Tatoeba website.#SEP The corpus is available for download from  the CLARIN:el repository.

This corpus contains subtitles from the OpenSubtitles website.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN:el repository.
This corpus contains law documents and texts related to education and culture.#SEPThe corpus is available for download through the CLARIN:el repository.
This corpus contains texts crawled from the Global Voices webpage.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a dedicated webpage.

The corpus consists of two main parts: manually aligned fiction and a number of collections: political commentaries published by Project Syndicate and VoxEurop, EU legal texts form the Acquis Communautaire corpus, proceedings of the European Parliament from the Europarl corpus, film subtitles from the Open Subtitles database, and the Bible.#SEPThe corpus is available primarily through the KonText concordancer. For research purposes, tailor-made linguistic data derived from the InterCorp corpus can be provided upon request. The contact e-mail is cnk@korpus.cz.

This corpus contains texts from the CORDIC and RAPID websites, and the press releases of the European Parliament and the European Southern Observatory.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN:EL repository.

This corpus contains legislative and legal texts from the Acquis Communautaire from various periods beginning in the 1950s.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the webpage of the European Commission.

This is a multilingual variant of the OPUS corpus that contains texts in the following languages: Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Swedish, Spanish, and Turkish.#SEPThe corpus is available through the concordancer Korp.

This corpus contains George Orwell’s 1984 original novel in English and its translations into the following languages: Bulgarian, Czech, Estonian, Hungarian, Macedonian, Persian, Polish, Romanian, Serbian, Slovak, and Slovenian.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

This corpus contains webcrawled data in the following languages: Czech, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Latvian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, and Spanish.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT. Additionally, the 2.0 version of the corpus, which includes six new languages (Irish, Croatian, Maltese, Lithuanian, Hungarian, and Estonian), can be downloaded from the corpus's dedicated website.

This corpus contains articles from the Official Journal of the European Communities from 1986 to 1994 in the following languages: Danish, Dutch, English, French, German, Greek, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the ELRA catalogue.
This corpus contains texts from the setimes.com website.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN:EL repository.

Corpus: ACCURAT balanced test corpus for under resourced languages
Description: This corpus contains texts in Greek, Slovenian, Romanian, Latvian, Estonian, Croatian, and Lithuanian.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN:el repository.

Corpus: UFAL Parallel Corpus of North Levantine 1.0
Description: This corpus contains multiparallel sentences in English, French, German, Greek, Spanish, and Standard Arabic.#SEPThe sentences have been selected from the OpenSubtitles2018 corpus and are manually translated into the North Levantine Arabic language.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT.

This corpus contains debates of the European Parliament in the following language pairs: Bulgarian-English, Czech-English, Portuguese-English, Spanish-English, and Basque-English.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT.

Corpus: MultiJur: Multilingual Parallel Corpus of Legal Texts
Description: This corpus contains international conventions and treaties in the following languages: English, Russian, German, Finnish, and Swedish.#SEPThe corpus is available through the concordancer Korp.

This corpus contains articles from Glossologia, a journal of general and historical Greek linguistics, in French, Greek, English, and German.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN:el repository.

This corpus contains fictional, journalistic, instructive and administrative texts in English, Dutch, and French.#SEPThe corpus is available for download (after registration) from the Dutch Language Institute.

The corpus contains parliamentary debates of the European Parliament. A subset is a parallel corpus for the following language combinations: English-German and English-Spanish.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a CLARIN-D repository.

This corpus contains debates of the European Parliament in Italian, English, and Spanish, with translations in all possible combinations.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the ELRA catalogue.

Annotation: tokenised, PoS-tagged, syntactically parsed, speech phenomena
Description: This is a parallel and comparable corpus of speeches held in the European Parliament; the corpus follows the European Parliament Interpreting Corpora tradition of the EPIC and EPICG corpora. It contains original speeches from 2008 to 2013 by English, German, and Spanish native speakers and their interpretation (English to and from German; Spanish to English).#SEPAll transcripts in the corpus are based on videos of the European Parliament Proceedings published by the European Parliament.#SEPAnnotation includes typical characteristics of spoken language such as false starts, hesitations and truncated words. To obtain better results for source-target alignment as well as sentence parsing the transcripts were segmented using a main clause approach: compound sentences were segmented separately. For the second version of the corpus, the transcripts were processed clause by clause with the spaCy NLP tools; the data is encoded in CoNLL-U and provides universal PoS tags, fine-grained language-specific PoS tags as well as Universal Dependency syntactic relations. All data was enriched with relevant metadata such as source language, name of original speaker, speech timing, mode of delivery and delivery rate.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from CLARIN-D (Saarland University B-centre).
This parallel multimodal corpus contains English, Greek, and French.#SEPThe corpus is distributed by CLARIN:EL.

Corpus: PANACEA English-French and English-Greek parallel corpus
Description: This corpus contains environmental and legislative texts in English and their French and Greek translations.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the ELRA catalogue.
This corpus is available for download from the CLARIN PL repository.

This corpus contains news articles and commentaries in Czech, Russian, and English from the Project Syndicate website from 1995 to 2008.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT and through the concordancer Korp.
